DataElement.preferredName: Invasive Endometrioid Stromal Sarcoma Margin Distance Value
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The numeric response that indicates the distance from the tumor margin to the Endometrioid Stromal Sarcoma.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Invasive Endometrioid Stromal Sarcoma Margin Distance
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Marked by a tendency to spread, especially into healthy surrounding tissue._A malignant mesenchymal neoplasm that affects the uterine corpus, and rarely, the ovaries, cervix, and vagina. In the uterine corpus it is classified as low grade or high grade endometrial stromal sarcoma. In the remainder of the anatomic sites it is classified as low grade endometrioid stromal sarcoma._A boundary line or the area immediately inside the boundary._The space separating two objects or points.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Marked by a tendency to spread, especially into healthy surrounding tissue.:A malignant mesenchymal neoplasm that affects the uterine corpus, and rarely, the ovaries, cervix, and vagina. In the uterine corpus it is classified as low grade or high grade endometrial stromal sarcoma. In the remainder of the anatomic sites it is classified as low grade endometrioid stromal sarcoma.

Concepts.definition: Marked by a tendency to spread, especially into healthy surrounding tissue.

A malignant mesenchymal neoplasm that affects the uterine corpus, and rarely, the ovaries, cervix, and vagina. In the uterine corpus it is classified as low grade or high grade endometrial stromal sarcoma. In the remainder of the anatomic sites it is classified as low grade endometrioid stromal sarcoma.

Property.preferredDefinition: Margin; the boundary line or the area immediately inside the boundary.:The space between two objects or points.

Concepts.definition: A boundary line or the area immediately inside the boundary.
The space separating two objects or points.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: indication of the presence and extent of disease.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: the numeric value for the distance of invasive carcinoma from the nearest margin.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: any measurements of a patient's surgical margins.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Value; a numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

Concepts.definition: A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.
